Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 19, mean = 52, sd = 5.3. Sample 2: n = 13, mean = 37, sd = 3.29. The pooled variance estimator takes the value of 21.18. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 32 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 30 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 19 and 13 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 18 and 12 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 32 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 30 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 19 and 13 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 18 and 12 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
